content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word

content.question: Lisa became more voluble as she got more excited.
Marcus deemed it necessary to spend all weekend preparing his presentation.
You can collect exorbitant fees for doing something everyone needs done but no one wants to do.
The organization offered a subsidy to researchers willing to study pond scum.
Yvette belittled her contribution to the success of the project.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word

content.question: Paul expected a censure for being out past curfew.
The tree is moribund.
Alex was uncomfortable seeing amorous displays in public.
He used his bonus to treat his parents to a sumptuous dinner.
Unfortunately, Greg is likely to divulge other people’s secrets.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question. Then fill in the circle next to your answer.

content.question: Who is most likely to issue an injunction prohibiting something?
Fateful refers to something’s
An ingrate lacks
In which class are you most likely to study a motif?
To expostulate is to attempt to

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: “How could you divulge my secret to everyone?” Afshan asked the minute I sat down next to her at lunch.
“What are you talking about?” I replied, trying hard to remember any secrets she might have shared with me.

I frowned. What had she told me that could be deemed a secret? The usually voluble Afshan sat there silently, her arms crossed under her irate visage. Finally something clicked in my apparently moribund brain cells.
“Oh! You mean telling Mina and Devere that you’re trying out for the track team?”
Afshan said nothing and nodded angrily, biting into her sandwich.

“I didn’t know you were keeping that a secret,” I said. “I thought you would want your best friends to know so they could wish you good luck.” Afshan’s face softened a little. I handed her my apple and banana. “I saved these for you,” I said.
Afshan rolled her eyes, but I also saw her start to smile.
“Ingrate!” I said, laughing. “You didn’t even thank me for providing healthy snacks so you’ll have energy to try out for the team!”
Finally, Afshan laughed, and I knew I was forgiven. What a relief!

content.question: The word divulge (line 1) most nearly means
The meaning of deemed (line 6) is
In line 7, voluble most nearly means
In line 9, moribund means
The word ingrate (line 19) most nearly means
